Key Match Events: The Minnesota Timberwolves beat the Orlando Magic 104-89 for their third straight victory.
Darius Garland scored a season-high 40 points for the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Alperen Sengun had 32 points and 14 rebounds for the Houston Rockets.
Jaden Hardy scored a season-high 25 points off the bench for the Dallas Mavericks.
Tyler Herro scored 23 points and Jaime Jaquez had 20 for the Miami Heat.
Post-Match Reflections: The Minnesota Timberwolves extended their win streak to three games with the victory over the Orlando Magic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cleveland Cavaliers are tied for the fifth-best record in league history through 37 games at 33-4.
The Houston Rockets solidified their hold on second place in the Western Conference, moving 1 1/2 games ahead of Memphis.
The Miami Heat made the most of transition points (17-7) and hustle plays when it mattered.
Others: The Orlando Magic lost to the Minnesota Timberwolves 104-89.
The Minnesota Timberwolves' Julius Randle had 23 points and 10 rebounds, and Anthony Edwards added 21 points and seven assists.
